verses.text: And Shebaniah, and Joshaphat and Nethanel and Amasai, and Zechariah, and Benaiah, and Eliezer the Priests did blow with trumpets before the Ark of God, and Obed-Edom and Jehiah were porters for the Ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David and the Elders of Israel and the captains of thousands went to bring up the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed-Edom with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because that God helped the Levites that bare the Ark of the covenant of the Lord, they offered seven bullocks and seven rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David had on him a linen garment, as all the Levites that bare the Ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah that had the chief charge of the singers: and upon David was a linen Ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all Israel brought up the Ark of the Lord’s covenant with shouting, and sound of cornet, and with trumpets, and with cymbals, making a sound with viols and with harps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Ark of the covenant of the Lord came into the city of David, Michal the daughter of Saul looked out at a window, and saw king David dancing and playing, and she despised him in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought in the Ark of God, and set it in the midst of the Tabernacle that David had pitched for it, and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when David had made an end of offering the burnt offering and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the Name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he dealt to every one of Israel both man and woman, to every one a cake of bread, and a piece of flesh, and a bottle of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the Ark of the Lord, and to rehearse and to thank and praise the Lord God of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed-Edom, even Jeiel with instruments, viols, and harps, and Asaph to make a sound with cymbals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Benaiah and Jahaziel Priests, with trumpets continually before the Ark of the covenant of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then at that time David did appoint at the beginning to give thanks to the Lord by the hand of Asaph and his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Praise the Lord and call upon his Name: declare his works among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing unto him, sing praise unto him, and talk of all his wonderful works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice in his holy Name: let the hearts of them that seek the Lord, rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seek the Lord and his strength: seek his face continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember his marvelous works that he hath done, his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O seed of Israel his servant, O the children of Jacob his chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the Lord our God: his judgments are throughout all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember his Covenant forever, and the word, which he commanded to a thousand generations:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which he made with Abraham, and his oath to Isaac:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And hath confirmed it to Jacob for a Law, and to Israel for an everlasting Covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, To thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When ye were few in number, yea, a very few, and strangers therein,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And walked about from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He suffered no man to do them wrong, but rebuked Kings for their sakes, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Touch not mine anointed, and do my Prophets no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing unto the Lord all the earth: declare his salvation from day to day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Declare his glory among the nations, and his wonderful works among all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord is great and much to be praised, and he is to be feared above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the gods of the people are idols, but the Lord made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Praise and glory are before him: power and beauty are in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give unto the Lord, ye families of the people: give unto the Lord glory and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give unto the Lord the glory of his Name: bring an offering and come before him, and worship the Lord in the glorious Sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tremble ye before him all the earth, surely the world shall be, and not move.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad, and let them say among the nations, The Lord reigneth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the sea roar, and all that therein is: let the field be joyful and all that is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the trees of the wood then rejoice at the presence of the Lord: for he cometh to judge the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Praise the Lord, for he is good, for his mercy endureth forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say ye, Save us, O God, our salvation, and gather us, and deliver us from the heathen, that we may praise thine holy Name, and glory in thy praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel forever and ever: and let all people say, So be it, and praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he left there before the Ark of the Lord’s Covenant Asaph and his brethren to minister continually before the Ark, that which was to be done every day:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Obed-Edom and his brethren, threescore and eight: and Obed-Edom the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah were porters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zadok the Priest and his brethren the Priests were before the Tabernacle of the Lord, in the high place that was at Gibeon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To offer burnt offerings unto the Lord, upon the burnt offering altar continually, in the morning and in the evening, even according unto all that is written in the Law of the Lord, which he commanded Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with them were Heman, and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen (which were appointed by names) to praise the Lord, because his mercy endureth forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even with them were Heman and Jeduthun, to make a sound with the cornets and with the cymbals, with excellent instruments of music: and the sons of Jeduthun were at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people departed, every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now afterward when David dwelt in his house, he said to Nathan the Prophet, Behold, I dwell in an house of cedar trees, but the Ark of the Lord’s Covenant remaineth under curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nathan said to David, Do all that is in thine heart: for God is with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the same night even the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go, and tell David my servant, Thus saith the Lord, Thou shalt not build me an house to dwell in:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have dwelt in no house since the day that I brought out the children of Israel unto this day, but I have been from tent to tent, and from habitation to habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore I have walked with all Israel, spake I one word to any of the Judges of Israel (whom I commanded to feed my people) saying, Why have ye not built me an house of cedar trees?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore thus shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote and from following the sheep, that thou shouldest be a prince over my people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have been with thee whithersoever thou hast walked, and have destroyed all thine enemies out of thy sight, and have made thee a name, like the name of the great men that are in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Also I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant it, that they may dwell in their place, and move no more: neither shall the wicked people vex them anymore, as at the beginning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And since the time that I commanded judges over my people Israel) And I will subdue all thine enemies: therefore I say unto thee, that the Lord will build thee an house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when thy days shall be fulfilled to go with thy fathers, then will I raise up thy seed after thee, which shall be of thy sons, and will establish his kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall build me an house, and I will establish his throne forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be his father, and he shall be my son, and I will not take my mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will establish him in mine house, and in my kingdom forever, and his throne shall be established forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all these words, and according to all this vision. So Nathan spake to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David the king went in and sat before the Lord, and said, Who am I, O Lord God, and what is mine house, that thou hast brought me hitherto?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet thou esteeming this a small thing, O God, hast also spoken concerning the house of thy servant for a great while, and hast regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What can David desire more of thee for the honor of thy servant? for thou knowest thy servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, for thy servant’s sake, even according to thine heart hast thou done all this great thing to declare all magnificence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, there is none like thee, neither is there any God besides thee according to all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover what one nation in the earth is like thy people Israel, whose God went to redeem them to be his people, and to make thyself a Name, and to do great and terrible things by casting out Nations from before thy people, whom thou hast delivered out of Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou hast ordained thy people Israel to be thine own people forever, and thou Lord art become their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now Lord, let the thing that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant, and concerning his house, be confirmed forever, and do as thou hast said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let thy Name be stable and magnified forever, that it may be said, The Lord of hosts, God of Israel, is the God of Israel, and let the house of David thy servant be established before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou, O my God, hast revealed unto the ear of thy servant, that thou wilt build him an house: therefore thy servant hath been bold to pray before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now Lord (for thou art God, and hast spoken this goodness unto thy servant.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore it hath pleased thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may be before thee forever: for thou, O Lord, hast blessed it, and it shall be blessed forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after this, David smote the Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath, and the villages thereof out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he smote Moab, and the Moabites became David’s servants, and brought gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David smote Hadadezer King of Zobah unto Hamath, as he went to establish his border by the river Perath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen, and destroyed all the chariots, but he reserved of them an hundred chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the Aramites of Damascus to succor Hadadezer king of Zobah, but David slew of the Aramites two and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David put a garrison in Aram of Damascus, and the Aramites became David’s servants, and brought gifts: and the Lord preserved David wheresoever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took the shields of gold that were of the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from Tibhath, and from Chun (cities of Hadadezer) brought David exceeding much brass, wherewith Solomon made the brazen Sea, and the pillars and the vessels of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Tou King of Hamath heard how David had smitten all the host of Hadadezer king of Zobah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he sent Hadoram his son to king David, to salute him, and to rejoice with him, because he had fought against Hadadezer, and beaten him (for Tou had war with Hadadezer) who brought all vessels of gold and silver and brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And king David did dedicate them unto the Lord, with the silver and gold that he brought from all the nations, from Edom, and from Moab, and from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abishai the son of Zeruiah smote of Edom in the salt valley eighteen thousand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put a garrison in Edom, and all the Edomites became David’s servants: and the Lord preserved David wheresoever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David reigned over all Israel, and executed judgment and justice to all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host, and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud Recorder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech the son of Abiathar were the Priests, and Shavsha the Scribe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites: and the sons of David were chief about the King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this also Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said, I will show kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness unto me. And David sent messengers to comfort him for his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest thou that David doth honor thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? Are not his servants come to thee to search, to seek and to spy out the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments by the half unto the buttocks, and sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there went certain and told David concerning the men: and he sent to meet them (for the men were exceedingly ashamed) and the King said, Tarry at Jericho, until your beards be grown: then return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the children of Ammon saw that they stank in the sight of David, then sent Hanun and the children of Ammon a thousand talents of silver, to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Aram Naharaim, and out of Aram Maacah, and out of Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they hired them two and thirty thousand chariots, and the king of Maacah and his people, which came and pitched before Medeba: and the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when David heard it, he sent Joab and all the host of the valiant men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Ammon came out, and set their battle in array at the gate of the city. And the kings that were come, were by themselves in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joab saw that the front of the battle was against him before and behind, then he chose out of all the choice of Israel, and set himself in array to meet the Aramites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the rest of the people he delivered unto the hand of Abishai his brother, and they put themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, If Aram be too strong for me, then thou shalt succor me: and if the children of Ammon prevail against thee, then I will succor thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong, and let us show ourselves valiant for our people, and for the cities of our God, and let the Lord do that which is good in his own sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joab and the people that was with him, came near before the Aramites unto the battle, and they fled before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the children of Ammon saw that the Aramites fled, they fled also before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city: so Joab came to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Aramites saw that they were discomfited before Israel, they sent messengers, and caused the Aramites to come forth that were beyond the river: and Shophach the captain of the host of Hadadezer went before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was showed David, he gathered all Israel, and went over Jordan, and came unto them, and put himself in array against them: And when David had put himself in battle array to meet the Aramites, they fought with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Aramites fled before Israel, and David destroyed of the Aramites seven thousand chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they fell before Israel, they made peace with David, and served him. And the Aramites would no more succor the children of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the year was expired, in the time that kings go out a warfare, Joab carried out the strength of the army, and destroyed the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah (but David tarried at Jerusalem) and Joab smote Rabbah, and destroyed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David took the crown of their king from off his head, and found it the weight of a talent of gold with precious stones in it: and it was set on David’s head, and he brought away the spoil of the city exceeding much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he carried away the people that were in it, and cut them with saws, and with harrows of iron, and with axes: even thus did David with all the cities of the children of Ammon. Then David and all the people came again to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after this also there arose war at Gezer with the Philistines: then Sibbechai the Hushathite slew Sippai of the children of Haraphah, and they were subdued.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was yet another battle with the Philistines: and Elhanan the son of Jair slew Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, whose spear staff was like a weaver’s beam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And yet again there was a battle at Gath, where was a man of a great stature, and his fingers were by sixes, even four and twenty, and was also the son of Haraphah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he reviled Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea David’s brother did slay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were born unto Haraphah at Gath, and fell by the hand of David, and by the hands of his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Satan stood up against Israel, and provoked David to number Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore David said to Joab, and to the rulers of the people, Go, and number Israel from Beersheba even to Dan, and bring it to me, that I may know the number of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab answered, The Lord increased his people an hundred times so many as they be, O my lord the king: are they not all my lord’s servants? wherefore doeth my lord require this thing? why should he be a cause of trespass to Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the king’s word prevailed against Joab. And Joab departed and went through all Israel, and returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab gave the number and sum of the people unto David: and all Israel were eleven hundred thousand men that drew sword: and Judah was four hundred and seventy thousand men that drew sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites and Benjamin counted he not among them: for the King’s word was abominable to Joab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God was displeased with this thing: therefore he smote Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said unto God, I have sinned greatly, because I have done this thing: but now, I beseech thee, remove the iniquity of thy servant: for I have done very foolishly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Gad David’s Seer, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and tell David, saying, Thus saith the Lord, I offer thee three things: choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gad came to David, and said unto him, Thus saith the Lord, Take to thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Either three years famine, or three months to be destroyed before thine adversaries, and the sword of thine enemies to take thee, or else the sword of the Lord and pestilence in the land three days, that the Angel of the Lord may destroy throughout all the coasts of Israel: now therefore advise thee, what word I shall bring again to him that sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said unto Gad, I am in a wonderful strait, let me now fall into the hand of the Lord: for his mercies are exceedingly great, and let me not fall into the hand of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord sent a pestilence in Israel, and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God sent the Angel into Jerusalem to destroy it. And as he was destroying, the Lord beheld, and repented of the evil, and said to the Angel that destroyed, It is now enough, let thine hand cease. Then the Angel of the Lord stood by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David lifted up his eyes, and saw the Angel of the Lord stand between the earth and the heaven, with his sword drawn in his hand and stretched out toward Jerusalem. Then David and the Elders of Israel which were clothed in sack, fell upon their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said unto God, Is it not I that commanded to number the people? It is even I that have sinned and have committed evil, but these sheep, what have they done? O Lord my God, I beseech thee, let thine hand be on me and on my father’s house, and not on thy people for their destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Angel of the Lord commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up, and set up an altar unto the Lord in the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David went up according to the saying of Gad, which he had spoken in the Name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ornan turned about and saw the Angel, and his four sons that were with him, hid themselves, and Ornan threshed wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshing floor, and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Ornan, Give me the place of thy threshing floor, that I may build an altar therein unto the Lord: give it me for sufficient money, that the plague may be stayed from the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ornan said unto David, Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do that which seemeth him good: lo, I give thee bullocks for burnt offerings, and threshing instruments for wood, and wheat for meat offering, I give it all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And King David said to Ornan, Not so: but I will buy it for sufficient money: for I will not take that which is thine for the Lord, nor offer burnt offerings without cost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David gave to Ornan for that place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David built there an altar unto the Lord, and offered burnt offerings, and peace offerings, and called upon the Lord, and he answered him by fire from heaven upon the altar of burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lord had spoken to the Angel, he put up his sword again into his sheath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time when David saw that the Lord had heard him in the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (But the Tabernacle of the Lord which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offering were at that season in the high place at Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David could not go before it to ask counsel at God: for he was afraid of the sword of the Angel of the Lord.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said, This is the house of the Lord God, and this is the altar for the burnt offering of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David commanded to gather together the strangers that were in the land of Israel, and he set masons to hew and polish stones to build the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David also prepared much iron for the nails of the doors and of the gates, and for the joinings, and abundance of brass passing weight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And cedar trees without number: for the Sidonians and they of Tyre brought much cedar wood to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and we must build an house for the Lord, magnifical, excellent and of great fame and dignity throughout all countries: I will therefore now prepare for him. So David prepared very much before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called Solomon his son, and charged him to build an house for the Lord God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Solomon, My son, I purposed with myself to build an house to the Name of the Lord my God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word of the Lord came to me, saying, Thou hast shed much blood, and hast made great battles: thou shalt not build an house unto my name: for thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a son is born to thee, which shall be a man of rest, for I will give him rest from all his enemies round about: therefore his name is Solomon: and I will send peace and quietness upon Israel in his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall build an house for my Name, and he shall be my son, and I will be his father, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom upon Israel forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore my son, the Lord shall be with thee, and thou shalt prosper, and thou shalt build an house to the Lord thy God, as he hath spoken of thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the Lord give thee wisdom and understanding, and give thee charge over Israel, even to keep the Law of the Lord thy God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then thou shalt prosper, if thou take heed to observe the statutes and the judgments which the Lord commanded Moses for Israel: be strong and of good courage: fear not, neither be afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, according to my poverty have I prepared for the house of the Lord an hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver, and of brass and of iron passing weight: for there was abundance. I have also prepared timber and stone, and thou mayest provide more thereto.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover thou hast workmen with thee enough, hewers of stone, and workmen of timber, and all men expert in every work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of gold, of silver, and of brass, and of iron there is no number: Up therefore, and be doing, and the Lord will be with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not the Lord your God with you, and hath given you rest on every side? for he hath given the inhabitants of the land into mine hand, and the land is subdued before the Lord, and before his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now set your hearts and your souls to seek the Lord your God, and arise, and build the Sanctuary of the Lord God, to bring the Ark of the covenant of the Lord, and the holy vessels of God into the house built for the Name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son King over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gathered together all the princes of Israel with the Priests and the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Levites were numbered from the age of thirty years and above, and their number according to their sum was eight and thirty thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of these four and twenty thousand were set to advance the work of the house of the Lord, and six thousand were overseers and judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And four thousand were porters, and four thousand praised the Lord with instruments which he made to praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David divided offices unto them, to wit, to the sons of Levi, to Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Gershonites were Laadan and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Laadan, the chief was Jehiel, and Zetham and Joel, three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Sons of Shimei, Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three: these were the chief fathers of Laadan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the sons of Shimei were Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah: these four were the sons of Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second, but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons: therefore they were in the families of their father, counted but as one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel, four.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Amram, Aaron and Moses: and Aaron was separated to sanctify the most holy place, he and his sons forever to burn incense before the Lord, to minister to him, and to bless in his Name forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses also the man of God and his children were named with the tribe of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Moses were Gershon, and Eliezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Gershon was Shebuel the chief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the son of Eliezer was Rehabiah the chief: for Eliezer had none other sons: but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Izhar was Shelomith the chief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hebron were Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Uzziel were Michah the first, and Jesshiah the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli, Eleazar and Kish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters, and their brethren the sons of Kish took them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Mushi were Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Levi according to the house of their fathers, even the chief fathers according to their offices, according to the number of names, and their sum that did the work for the service of the house of the Lord from the age of twenty years and above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David said, The Lord God of Israel hath given rest unto his people, that they may dwell in Jerusalem forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And also the Levites shall no more bear the Tabernacle and all the vessels for the service thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore according to the last words of David, the Levites were numbered from twenty years and above,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their office was under the hand of the sons of Aaron, for the service of the house of the Lord in the courts, and chambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, and in the work of the service of the house of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both for the showbread, and for the fine flour, for the meat offering, and for the unleavened cakes, and for the fried things, and for that which was roasted, and for all measures and size,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for to stand every morning, to give thanks and praise to the Lord, and likewise at even,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to offer all burnt offerings unto the Lord in the Sabbaths, in the months, and at the appointed times, according to the number and according to their custom, continually before the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that they should keep the charge of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and the charge of the holy place, and the charge of the sons of Aaron their brethren in the service of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are also the divisions of the sons of Aaron: The sons of Aaron were Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children: therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the Priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David distributed them, even Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar according to their offices in their ministration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were found more of the sons of Eleazar by the number of men, than of the sons of Ithamar, and they divided them, to wit, among the sons of Eleazar, sixteen heads, according to the household of their fathers, and among the sons of Ithamar, according to the household of their fathers, eight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus they distributed them by lot the one from the other, and so the rulers of the Sanctuary and the rulers of the house of God were of the sons of Eleazar, and of the sons of Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shemaiah the son of Nethanel the Scribe of the Levites, wrote them before the king and the princes, and Zadok the Priest, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and before the chief fathers of the Priests and of the Levites, one family being reserved for Eleazar, and another reserved for Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first lot fell to Jehoiarib, and the second to Jedaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh to Hakkoz, the eight to Abijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezekel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one and twenty to Jachin, the two and twenty to Gamul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The three and twenty to Delaiah, the four and twenty to Maaziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were their orders according to their offices, when they entered into the house of the Lord according to their custom under the hand of Aaron their father, as the Lord God of Israel had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the sons of Levi that remained of the sons of Amram, was Shubael, of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Rehabiah, even of the sons of Rehabiah, the first Isshiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Izhari, Shelomoth, of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his sons, Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Uzziel was Michah, the son of Michah was Shamir,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The brother of Michah was Isshiah, the son of Isshiah, Zechariah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari, were Mahli and Mushi, the son of Jaaziah was Beno,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari, of Jaaziah were Beno, and Shoham, and Zaccur and Ibri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Mahli came Eleazar, which had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Kish: the son of Kish was Jerahmeel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Mushi were Mahli, and Eder, and Jerimoth: these were sons of the Levites after the household of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these also cast lots with their brethren the sons of Aaron before King David, and Zadok and Ahimelech and the chief fathers of the Priests, and of the Levites, even the chief of the families against their younger brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David and the captains of the army separated for the ministry the sons of Asaph, and Heman, and Jeduthun, who should sing prophesies with harps, with viols, and with cymbals, and their number was even of the men for the office of their ministry, to wit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Asaph, Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asharelah the sons of Asaph were under the hand of Asaph, which sang prophecies by the commission of the King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun, Gedaliah, and Zeri, and Jeshaiah, Hashabiah and Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father: Jeduthun sang prophecies with an harp, for to give thanks and to praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Heman, the sons of Heman, Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the sons of Heman, the King’s Seer in the words of God to lift up the horn: and God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were under the hand of their father singing in the house of the Lord with cymbals, viols and harps, for the service of the house of God, and Asaph, and Jeduthun, and Heman were at the King’s commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So was their number with their brethren that were instructed in the songs of the Lord, even of all that were cunning, two hundred fourscore and eight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast lots, charge against charge, as well small as great, the cunning man as the scholar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first lot fell to Joseph, which was of Asaph, the second, to Gedaliah, who with his brethren and his sons were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third, to Zaccur, he, his sons and his brethren were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth, to Jizri, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth, to Nethaniah, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth, to Bukkiah, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh, to Jesharelah, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighth to Jeshaiah, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth to Mattaniah, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth to Shimei, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh to Azarel, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth to Hashabiah, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thirteenth to Shubael, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourteenth to Mattithiah, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifteenth to Jeremoth, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixteenth to Hananiah, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventeenth to Joshbekashah, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighteenth to Hanani, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nineteenth to Mallothi, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twentieth to Eliathah, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one and twentieth to Hothir, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two and twentieth to Giddalti, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The three and twentieth to Mahazioth, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The four and twentieth to Romamti-Ezer, he, his sons and his brethren twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning the divisions of the porters, of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore of the sons of Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Meshelemiah, Zechariah the eldest, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, and Eliehoenai the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Obed-Edom, Shemaiah the eldest, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sacar the fourth, and Nethanel the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eight: for God had blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Shemaiah his son were sons born that ruled in the house of their father, for they were men of might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, Elzabad, and his brethren, strong men: Elihu also, and Semachiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were of the sons of Obed-Edom, they and their sons and their brethren mighty and strong to serve, even threescore and two of Obed-Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Meshelemiah sons and brethren, eighteen mighty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Hosah of the sons of Merari, the sons were Shimri the chief, and (though he was not the eldest, yet his father made him the chief)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, and Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and the brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of these were the divisions of the porters, of the chief men, having the charge against their brethren, to serve in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast lots both small and great, for the house of their fathers, for every gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the lot on the East side fell to Shelemiah: then they cast lots for Zechariah his son a wise counselor, and his lot came out Northward:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Obed-Edom Southward, and to his sons the house of Asuppim:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Shuppim and to Hosah Westward with the gate of Shallecheth by the paved street that goeth upward, ward over against ward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eastward were six Levites, and Northward four a day, and Southward four a day, and toward Asuppim two and two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Parbar toward the West were four by the paved street, and two in Parbar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the divisions of the porters of the sons of Korah, and of the sons of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the Levites. Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God, and over the treasures of the dedicate things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Laadan the sons of the Gershonites descending of Laadan, the chief fathers of Laadan were Gershon and Jehieli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jehieli were Zetham and Joel his brother, appointed over the treasures of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Amramites, of the Izharites, of the Hebronites, and of the Uzzielites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, a ruler over the treasures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of his brethren which came of Eliezer, was Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which Shelomith and his brethren were over all the treasures of the dedicate things, which David the king, and the chief fathers, the captains over thousands, and hundreds, and the captains of the army had dedicated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For of the battles and of the spoils they did dedicate to maintain the house of the Lord.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all that Samuel the Seer had dedicated, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah, and whosoever had dedicated anything, it was under the hand of Shelomith, and his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Izharites was Chenaniah and his sons, for the business without over Israel, for officers and for Judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, men of activity, a thousand and seven hundred were officers for Israel beyond Jordan Westward in all the business of the Lord, and for the service of the King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among the Hebronites was Jerijah the chiefest, even the Hebronites by his generations according to the families. And in the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for: and there were found among them men of activity at Jazer in Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his brethren men of activity, two thousand and seven hundred chief fathers, whom King David made rulers over the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, for every matter pertaining to God, and for the king’s business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel also after their number, even the chief fathers and captains of thousands and of hundreds, and their officers that served the king by divers courses, which came in and went out, month by month throughout all the months of the year: in every course were four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the first course for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel: and in his course were four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Perez was the chief over all the princes of the armies for the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the course of the second month was Dodai an Ahohite, and this was his course, and Mikloth was a captain, and in his course were four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain of the third host for the third month was Benaiah the son of Jehoiada the chief Priest: and in his course were four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Benaiah was mighty among thirty and above the thirty, and in his course was Ammizabad his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him: and in his course were four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth for the fifth month was prince Shamhuth the Izrahite: and in his course four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite: and in his course four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the sons of Ephraim: and in his course four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eight for the eight month was Sibbechai the Hushathite of the Zarhites: and in his course four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite of the sons of Jemini: and in his course four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite of the Zarhites: and in his course four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite of the sons of Ephraim: and in his course four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel: and in his course four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the rulers over the tribes of Israel were these: over the Reubenites was ruler, Eliezer the son of Zichri: over the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maachah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel: over them of Aaron, and Zadok:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over Judah, Elihu of the brethren of David: over Issachar, Omri the son of Michael:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah: over Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the sons of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah: over the half tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the other half of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah: over Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These are the princes of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David took not the number of them from twenty years old and under, because the Lord had said that he would increase Israel like unto the stars of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab the son of Zeruiah began to number: but he finished it not, because there came wrath for it against Israel: neither was the number put into the Chronicles of king David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the king’s treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel: and over the treasures in the fields, in the cities and in the villages, and in the towers was Jehonathan the son of Uzziah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the workmen in the field that tilleth the ground, was Ezri the son of Chelub:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over them that dressed the vines, was Shimei the Ramathite: and over that which appertained to the vines, and over the store of the wine was Zabdi the Shiphmite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the olive trees and mulberry trees that were in the valleys, was Baal-Hanan the Gederite: and over the store of the oil was Joash:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the oxen that fed in Sharon, was Shitrai the Sharonite: and over the oxen in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the camels was Obil the Ishmaelite: and over the asses was Jehdeiah the Meronothite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the sheep was Jaziz the Hagrite: all these were the rulers of the substance that was king David’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehonathan David’s uncle a man of counsel and understanding (for he was a scribe) and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni were with the King’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ahithophel was the king’s counselor, and Hushai the Archite the king’s friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah and Abiathar: and captain of the King’s army was Joab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David assembled all the princes of Israel: the princes of the tribes, and the captains of the bands that served the King, and the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds, and the rulers of all the substance and possession of the king, and of his sons, with the eunuchs, and the mighty, and all the men of power, unto Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And King David stood up upon his feet, and said, Hear ye me, my brethren and my people: I purposed to have built an house of rest for the Ark of the covenant of the Lord, and for a footstool of our God, and have made ready for the building,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said unto me, Thou shalt not build an house for my Name, because thou hast been a man of war, and hast shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet as the Lord God of Israel chose me before all the house of my father, to be King over Israel forever (for in Judah would he choose a prince, and of the house of Judah is the house of my father, and among the sons of my father he delighted in me to make me king over all Israel)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So of all my sons (for the Lord hath given me many sons) he hath even chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto me, Solomon thy son, he shall build mine house and my courts: for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will establish therefore his kingdom forever, if he endeavor himself to do my commandments, and my judgments, as this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore in the sight of all Israel the congregation of the Lord, and in the audience of our God, keep and seek for all the commandments of the Lord your God, that ye may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance for your children after you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou, Solomon my son, know thou the God of thy father, and serve him with a perfect heart, and with a willing mind: For the Lord searcheth all hearts, and understandeth all the imaginations of thoughts: if thou seek him, he will be found of thee, but if thou forsake him, he will cast thee off forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed now, for the Lord hath chosen thee to build the house of the Sanctuary: be strong therefore and do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch and of the houses thereof, and of the closets thereof, and of the galleries thereof, and of the chambers thereof that are within, and of the house of the mercy seat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the pattern of all that he had in his mind for the courts of the house of the Lord, and for all the chambers round about, for the treasures of the house of God, and for the treasures of the dedicate things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the courses of the Priests, and of the Levites, and for all the work for the service of the house of the Lord, and for all the vessels of the ministry of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave of gold by weight, for the vessels of gold, for all the vessels of all manner of service, and all the vessels of silver by weight, for all manner vessels of all manner of service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The weight also of gold for the candlesticks, and gold for their lamps, with the weight for every candlestick, and for the lamps thereof, and for the candlesticks of silver by the weight of the candlestick, and the lamps thereof according to the use of every candlestick,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the weight of the gold for the tables of showbread, for every table, and silver for the tables of silver,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And pure gold for the fleshhooks, and the bowls, and plates, and for basins, gold in weight for every basin, and for silver basins, by weight for every basin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the altar of incense, pure gold by weight, and gold for the pattern of the chariot of the Cherubs that spread themselves, and covered the Ark of the covenant of the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All, said he, by writing sent to me by the hand of the Lord, which made me understand all the workmanship of the pattern.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and of a valiant courage, and do it: fear not, nor be afraid: for the Lord God, even my God is with thee: he will not leave thee, nor forsake thee, till thou hast finished all the work for the service of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold also, the companies of the Priests and the Levites for all the service of the house of God, even they shall be with thee for the whole work, with every free heart that is skillful in any manner of service. The princes also and all the people will be wholly at thy commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, David the King said unto all the Congregation, God hath chosen Solomon mine only son, young and tender, and the work is great: for this house is not for man, but for the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have prepared with all my power for the house of my God, gold for vessels of gold, and silver for them of silver, and brass for things of brass, iron for things of iron, and wood for things of wood, and onyx stones, and stones to be set, and carbuncle stones, and of divers colors, and all precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, because I have delight in the house of my God, I have of mine own gold and silver, which I have given to the house of my God, beside all that I have prepared for the house of the Sanctuary,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even three thousand talents of gold of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of fined silver to overlay the walls of the houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gold for the things of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and for all the work by the hands of artificers: and who is willing to fill his hand today unto the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the princes of the families, and the princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers of the king’s work, offered willingly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gave for the service of the house of God, five thousand talents of gold, and ten thousand pieces, and ten thousand talents of silver, and eighteen thousand talents of brass, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they with whom precious stones were found, gave them to the treasure of the house of the Lord, by the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people rejoiced when they offered willingly: for they offered willingly unto the Lord, with a perfect heart. And David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore David blessed the Lord before all the Congregation, and David said, Blessed be thou, O Lord God of Israel our father, forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine, O Lord, is greatness and power, and glory and victory, and praise: for all that is in heaven and in earth is thine: thine is the kingdom, O Lord, and thou excellest as head over all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both riches and honor come of thee, and thou reignest over all, and in thine hand is power and strength, and in thine hand it is to make great, and to give strength unto all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, our God, we thank thee, and praise thy glorious Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer willingly after this sort? for all things come of thee: and of thine own hand we have given thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are strangers before thee, and sojourners like all our fathers: our days are like the shadow upon the earth, and there is none abiding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord our God, all this abundance that we have prepared to build thee an house for thine holy Name, is of thine hand, and all is thine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know also my God, that thou triest the heart, and hast pleasure in righteousness: I have offered willingly in the uprightness of mine heart all these things: now also have I seen thy people which are found here, to offer unto thee willingly with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel our fathers, keep this forever in the purpose, and the thoughts of the heart of thy people, and prepare their hearts unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And give unto Solomon my son a perfect heart to keep thy commandments, thy testimonies, and thy statutes, and to do all things, and to build the house which I have prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to all the congregation, Now bless the Lord your God. And all the Congregation blessed the Lord God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads, and worshipped the Lord and the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they offered sacrifices unto the Lord, and on the morrow after that day, they offered burnt offerings unto the Lord, even a thousand young bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand sheep, with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did eat and drink before the Lord the same day with great joy, and they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him prince before the Lord, and Zadok for the high Priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord, as king instead of David his father, and prospered: and all Israel obeyed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the princes and men of power, and all the sons of king David submitted themselves under king Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord magnified Solomon in dignity, in the sight of all Israel, and gave him so glorious a kingdom, as no king had before him in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the space that he reigned over Israel, was forty years: seven years reigned he in Hebron, and three and thirty years reigned he in Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he died in a good age, full of days, riches and honor, and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning the acts of David the king, first and last, behold they are written in the book of Samuel the Seer, and in the book of Nathan the Prophet, and in the book of Gad the Seer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With all his reign and his power, and times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
